briefTitle: Alfuzosin Treatment in Children and Adolescents With Hydronephrosis of Neuropathic Etiology
officialTitle: 12-week, Multicenter, Open-label, Non-comparative Study to Investigate Pharmacodynamic and Safety of Alfuzosin 0.2 mg/kg/Day in the Treatment of Children and Adolescents 2 - 16 Years of Age With Hydronephrosis Associated With Elevated Detrusor Leak Point Pressure of Neuropathic Etiology Followed by a 40-week Open-label Extension
summary:
Primary objective was to determine efficacy of Alfuzosin in the treatment of children and adolescents 2-16 years of age with newly diagnosed or progressive hydronephrosis due to elevated detrusor Leak Point Pressure \[LPP\] of neuropathic etiology.

Secondary objectives were:

* To investigate the safety and tolerability of alfuzosin 0.2 mg/kg/day in children and adolescents,
* To investigate the number of Urinary Tract Infection (UTI) episodes,
* To investigate the pharmacokinetics of Alfuzosin (population kinetics).

primaryOutcome.measure: Number of Participants With a Decrease From Baseline ≥ 1 in the Society of Fetal Urology (SFU) Grade of Hydronephrosis
